courses.customDesc: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D1, D2, Upper-Division D, and GE Elective. Upper-Division B, Upper-Division C, and Upper-Division D should be taken only after junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to online catalog for GE course selection and United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP). USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: Upper-Division B, C1, Upper-Division C, D1, Upper-Division D or E.

Upper-Division B, Upper-Division C, and Upper-Division D should be taken only after junior standing is reached (90 units). USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: Upper-Division B, C1, Upper-Division C, D1, Upper-Division D or E.
Any free elective can go here. If GE courses are used to satisfy Support or Concentration requirements, additional free elective units may be required to satisfy 180 units for degree.

Students can attempt to fulfill the requirement after 90 earned units; students should complete the requirement before senior year. Any GWR class or GWR exam can go here. Refer to current catalog for prerequisites.

Any Concentration Approved Elective can go here. 12-14 units required depending on Career Area. 4 minimum units upper-division. See catalog for course options. Consultation with advisor recommended. No double-counting with Support.
See catalog for options. Courses taken in the Support Elective area cannot double count in Concentration.
